0.init_model_answer:

Option (a) describes a single event: "White House said the incident was a provocation, raised objection with Beijing"

2) "so that residents next to the airstrips would hear about its concerns over international airspace"

Based on the rules of probability, the likelihood of a single event occurring is always greater than or equal to the likelihood of two events co-occurring (the conjunction).
